articles.headline: Biden Works Against the Clock as Violence Escalates in the Middle East
articles.snippet: President Biden is beginning to acknowledge that he is simply running out of time to help forge a cease-fire and hostage deal with Hamas, his aides say. And the risk of a wider war has never looked greater.
articles.abstract: President Biden is beginning to acknowledge that he is simply running out of time to help forge a cease-fire and hostage deal with Hamas, his aides say. And the risk of a wider war has never looked greater.
articles.lead_paragraph: Israel’s ferocious assault on Hezbollah, its most violent exchange with the Lebanese militant group since 2006, is not only a major widening of the war but also a significant widening of the breach between President Biden and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

articles.headline: Israeli Strikes in Lebanon Kill Hundreds as Warplanes Target Hezbollah
articles.snippet: It was the deadliest day in decades of hostilities between Israel and the militants, who stepped up their own barrage of rockets.
articles.abstract: It was the deadliest day in decades of hostilities between Israel and the militants, who stepped up their own barrage of rockets.
articles.lead_paragraph: Dozens of Israeli fighter jets bombed Hezbollah targets in southern and eastern Lebanon on Monday, killing hundreds and wounding more than a thousand others, Lebanese officials said, in the deadliest attacks in the country since 2006, when Israel and Hezbollah fought their last all-out war.
articles.byline: By Patrick Kingsley, Euan Ward, Aaron Boxerman and Michael Levenson

articles.headline: China Is Striking Deals to Cement Its Role as Asia’s Trade Hub
articles.snippet: Beijing’s leaders are working with regional neighbors on the country’s western, northern and southern borders to develop new rail and sea links.
articles.abstract: Beijing’s leaders are working with regional neighbors on the country’s western, northern and southern borders to develop new rail and sea links.
articles.lead_paragraph: China has made several moves in recent months to advance its ambitious aim to become the trade and transportation hub of Asia.

articles.headline: These Maternity Homes Offer Sanctuary, but It Can Feel Oppressive
articles.snippet: Unregulated homes are proliferating amid abortion restrictions and a housing crunch. Some limit residents’ movements, contacts and day-to-day decisions.
articles.abstract: Unregulated homes are proliferating amid abortion restrictions and a housing crunch. Some limit residents’ movements, contacts and day-to-day decisions.
articles.lead_paragraph: In Naples, Fla., Sunlight Home offered refuge and a fresh start for pregnant women on the brink of homelessness. It also required them to get permission before leaving the property and to download a tracking app on their phones, former residents said and its policies show.

articles.headline: Biden Warns the World Is at an ‘Inflection Point’ Amid Global Crises
articles.snippet: In his final U.N. speech, President Biden framed his decision to drop his bid for re-election as a lesson that “some things are more important than staying in power.”
articles.abstract: In his final U.N. speech, President Biden framed his decision to drop his bid for re-election as a lesson that “some things are more important than staying in power.”
articles.lead_paragraph: President Biden used his final speech to the United Nations on Tuesday to celebrate his defense of Ukraine against Russia’s invasion and his work to restore the United States’ global alliances, but he also warned that the advances of his administration could easily fall apart if America returned to isolationism.
articles.byline: By Sheryl Gay Stolberg and David E. Sanger

articles.headline: Ukrainian Poet and Rock Star Fights Near Front and Performs Behind It
articles.snippet: Serhiy Zhadan, 50, is a beloved Ukrainian poet as well as a novelist, lyricist and rock star. Furious over the invasion, he enlisted to fight even as his band still plays and his readings fill halls.
articles.abstract: Serhiy Zhadan, 50, is a beloved Ukrainian poet as well as a novelist, lyricist and rock star. Furious over the invasion, he enlisted to fight even as his band still plays and his readings fill halls.
articles.lead_paragraph: When the Ukrainian army hit a crisis of recruitment earlier this year amid rising losses on the battlefield, one of the most popular cultural personalities in the country stepped up and enlisted.
articles.byline: By Carlotta Gall and Oleksandr Chubko

articles.headline: A Looming East Coast Port Strike Could Shake the Economy
articles.snippet: Businesses are preparing for a strike by dockworkers on the East and Gulf Coasts, which could begin Oct. 1 if negotiations don’t yield a new contract.
articles.abstract: Businesses are preparing for a strike by dockworkers on the East and Gulf Coasts, which could begin Oct. 1 if negotiations don’t yield a new contract.
articles.lead_paragraph: With dockworkers on the East and Gulf Coasts threatening to strike on Oct. 1, businesses have been accelerating imports, redirecting cargo and pleading with the Biden administration to prevent a walkout.

articles.headline: How Meta Distanced Itself From Politics
articles.snippet: Ahead of November’s election, Meta has de-emphasized political content on Facebook, Instagram and Threads and doesn’t want to talk about candidates or campaigns.
articles.abstract: Ahead of November’s election, Meta has de-emphasized political content on Facebook, Instagram and Threads and doesn’t want to talk about candidates or campaigns.
articles.lead_paragraph: In January 2021, after pro-Trump rioters stormed the U.S. Capitol, Mark Zuckerberg announced a new priority for Meta: He wanted to reduce the amount of political content on the company’s apps, including Facebook and Instagram.
articles.byline: By Sheera Frenkel and Mike Isaac

articles.headline: Mark Zuckerberg Is Done With Politics
articles.snippet: He was once a backer of liberal causes. Then everyone seemed to turn on him. Now he wants to stay away from politics — if that’s possible.
articles.abstract: He was once a backer of liberal causes. Then everyone seemed to turn on him. Now he wants to stay away from politics — if that’s possible.
articles.lead_paragraph: It was only a little more than a decade ago that Mark Zuckerberg had few qualms about airing his politics.
articles.byline: By Theodore Schleifer and Mike Isaac
